course.subject: COMP
course.name: Computer and Programming Fundamentals I
course.description: Introduction to computers and programming. Computer hardware and software. Problem solving. Program design. Procedural abstraction. Debugging and testing. Simple and structured data types. Recursive programming. Introduction to searching and sorting.
course.exclusions: COMP 1004 (prior to 2013-14), COMP 1021, COMP 1022P, COMP 1022Q

reviews.author: myusa
reviews.comment_content:
Course is based on the basics of the programming.                                                                            
Since they are considering the students as zero-level the knowledge is given is really boring for who knows a bit. Hovewer, when it comes to general of the class it is logical.
It can be said that content is sufficient for the 1st level. So I see the course as useful. But do not be upset if you cannot learn well this course, the content is the same as the resources you can find on the internet. But more u have higher, more you tend to programming.
reviews.comment_teaching:
As I mentioned, the course is based on the basics of the programming.But teaching of the professor was really well.
So I can say that I was happy with the teaching of the professor.The content is the same as the resources you can find on the internet. Thus it can be said that teaching does not matter.
reviews.comment_workload: I do not expect it to tire you.
